Bostonia

BU Interactive Design

Project Summary

Bostonia is BU’s award-winning, print and online alumni magazine. We build everything responsively, including the feature stories, and publish three times a year.

Role

First and foremost, Bostonia is a team effort: it truly takes a village.

My primary purpose is to maintain and improve the site’s front-end and CMS. I designed and built the current homepage design and internal page templates. The online magazine constantly evolves, however, so stay tuned.

I also build feature stories and interactive content for Bostonia. BU ID’s web designers translate the print magazine to the web, and the developers (myself included) make them real.

Highlights

  1. The current homepage and theme design.
  2. Our three-part feature on China (Spring 2014), available in both English and Chinese.
  3. Some of the features that I had the privilege to build: Wine, High Notes, Rowing to Kabul, Warming, Damages, More on Moore, and Secret Lives. I also designed nine stories in the Campaign 2012 issue, including Boston Scholars.
